page.title: 07TRANSPORT SEASCALE&GOSFORTH
page.content: { TRAINS} THE TRAINS WHICH RUN THROUGH SEASCALE ARE CALLED "PAY- TRAINS." THEY ARE DIESEL ELECTRIC {STATIONS}THERE ARE 27 STATIONS ON THE WEST CUMBRIAN LINE.SEASCALE IS AN HOUR AND 1 MINUTE FROM BARROW AND AN HOUR AND 42 MINUTES FROM CARLISLE. {SEASCALE STATION}13 PASSENGER TRAINS PASS THROUGH SEASCALE IN A WEEK DAY. SEASCALE IS AN UNMANNNED STATION THE MAIN FREIGHT IS COAL OR NUCLEAR WASTE WHICH COMES FROM SELLAFIELD AND IS DUMPED AT DRIGG. THERE IS A MINIATURE RAILWAY NEARBY WHICH RUNS FROM RAVENGLASS TO ESKDALE.THOUSANDS OF TOURISTS COME HERE EACH YEAR. THERE ARE 4 BUSSES TO WHITEHAVEN IN A DAY.OTHERS GO TO SELLAFIELD AND MILLOM.THERE IS A BUS TO TAKE CHILDREN TO SCHOOL AT WYNDHAM. MOST PEOPLE USE CARS TO GET AROUND.
